doc:
Dorothy Loudon https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dorothy_Loudon 0 Dorothy Loudon (September 17, 1925 – November 15, 2003) was an American actress and singer. She won the Tony Award for Best Lead Actress in a Musical in 1977 for her performance as Miss Hannigan in Annie. Loudon was also nominated for Tony Awards for her lead performances in the musicals The Fig Leaves Are Falling and Ballroom, as well as a Golden Globe award for her appearances on The Garry Moore Show. Dorothy_Loudon ( September_17_,_1925 – November_15_,_2003 ) was an_American_actress_and_singer . She won the_Tony_Award for Best_Lead_Actress in a_Musical in 1977 for her_performance as Miss_Hannigan in Annie . Loudon was_also_nominated for Tony_Awards for her_lead_performances in the_musicals The_Fig Leaves_Are_Falling_and_Ballroom , as_well_as a_Golden_Globe_award for her_appearances on The_Garry_Moore_Show .
